specs.title: Disable this template header?
specs.description: By default, the template header is enabled and shown when contents are defined. If you're using a customizable header module, you should either disable it and use the included customization below or select "Yes" to disable this template's header.

specs.title: Header logo text
specs.description: Type a short caption to use as logo text if you don't have an image logo. It will be rendered at the left of the header.

specs.title: Header logo icon/image
specs.description:
If you have a logo icon, you can select it here and have it rendered at the left of the logo text specified above.
If you have a logo image, you can leave the logo text empty and specify the logo here.
The icon or logo should have a height no bigger than 200px. It will be resized keeping the aspect ratio.

specs.title: Slogan/Links panel
specs.description:
You can add a slogan or links to local pages, external URLs or social network icons at the right of the logo.

If you decide to use a slogan, just type it in the code box.
If you decide to show links here, type a list using the next syntax: 
* Caption:     /local-path
* Caption:     http://external-site.com
* @brand-icon: http://well-known-brand-site.com
As you may notice, every link must be placed on a single line and started with an asterisk, like a bullet list.

Whatever you type as caption is shown as the link to either the path or the URL.

If instead of caption you type @brand-icon, the corresponding brand icon from the Font Awesome icon set will be rendered as caption. Full reference here.

Examples: 
* Home:      /
* Contact:   /contact
* @facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BardCanvas
* @twitter:  https://twitter.com/BardCanvas
* @linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/2447840/

specs.title: Background image
specs.description: The template comes with a pre-defined background image. Use this control to specify a different one.

specs.title: Background image position
specs.description: Only used when the body background image is specified.

specs.title: Background image size
specs.description: Specify a sizing directive for the body background image. In all cases, the aspect ratio is kept.

options.option: Cover the entire viewport, cropping the edges if needed (default)
Contain in the viewport, no cropping

specs.title: Background image repetition
specs.description: How do you want the image to be repeated?

specs.title: Listings to show
specs.description:
By default, this template shows the most recent posts grouped by category instead of the standard posts index. You can choose a different behavior here.

Note: The standard listing can be individually turned off from Posts reading/writing options > Indexes > Disable posts index on home page. If you select here an option that shows it and it doesn't shows, you should check if it is disabled.

specs.title: Post per category to show
specs.description: By default, only the last 3 posts will be shown per each category on the home per-category listings. You can change that amount here.

specs.title: Exclusive categories list
specs.description: By default, all categories will be scanned for posts on the home per-category listings. If you want to limit to specific categories, enter one slug per each line on this box.

specs.title: Disable this template footer?
specs.description: By default, the template footer is enabled and shown when contents are defined. This footer is an addition to the standard footer... it doesn't replace it, just adds a few sections above it for the Home and Main layouts.

specs.title: Contents for section #1
specs.description:
This section can be used with some "about us" information.

Note: The first line of the contents will be used as title for the section.

You can add a list of bullets with links using the same conventions used at the Slogan/links panel of the header, E.G.: 
* Caption:     /local-path
* Caption:     http://external-site.com
* @brand-icon: http://well-known-brand-site.com

specs.title: Contents for section #2
specs.description:
This section can be used with a list of quick links.

Note: The first line of the contents will be used as title for the section.

You can add a list of bullets with links using the same syntax as above.

specs.title: Contents for section #3
